{"step_by_step_thinking": "Pterion is a region on the side of the skull. It is a point where four skull bones meet, namely the frontal, parietal, sphenoid, and temporal bones. It does not have anything to do with 'bregma' and 'lamba'. It is not a region of the postero-lateral fontanelle merge. It also does not lie deep to the zygomatic arch.", "answer_choice": "A"}
